      Composes a text span with a tooltip to be shown on hover
      static java.lang.String getSpanWithTooltipAndDisplayName(org.openrdf.model.Value value)
      Composes a text span for the value showing - for URIs: display name (in italic font) and the URI (in brackets, if different from the display name), both underlined - for literals: the value itself When hovering over the span, a tooltip is shown, containing the info about datatype and actual value.

      • configDefaultValueToString

        public static java.lang.String configDefaultValueToString(com.fluidops.iwb.model.ParameterConfigDoc configAnnotation)
        The string representation of this default value, i.e. "Default: " If the default value is undefined or the empty string, this method returns an empty string
        Parameters:

      • getSpanWithTooltipAndDisplayName

        public static java.lang.String getSpanWithTooltipAndDisplayName(org.openrdf.model.Value value)
        Composes a text span for the value showing - for URIs: display name (in italic font) and the URI (in brackets, if different from the display name), both underlined - for literals: the value itself When hovering over the span, a tooltip is shown, containing the info about datatype and actual value. Currently used to show the existing values in the edit mode in the triple editor.

      • getSpan

        public static java.lang.String getSpan(java.lang.String encodedContent,
                       java.lang.String encodedTooltip)
        Composes a text span with a tooltip to be shown on hover
        Parameters:
        encodedContent - Text content (assumed to be already in HTML)
        encodedTooltip - Tooltip message (assumed to be already in HTML)
        Returns:

      • getAHrefWithTooltip

        public static java.lang.String getAHrefWithTooltip(org.openrdf.model.Value value,
                                   java.lang.String comment)
        Returns the HTML link to this value with the help of RequestMapper.getAHref(Value, String, String). The tooltip is built combining the given comment if available and the value representation with createKeyValueTooltip(Value) The method escapes HTML in the tooltip. and the label is retrieved from the datamanager. This method replaces linebreaks in the label with a HTML br.
        Parameters:
        value -
        comment -
        Returns:

      • createKeyValueTooltip

        public static java.lang.String createKeyValueTooltip(org.openrdf.model.Value val)
        Create the tooltip for a given Value. Depicts additional available information (e.g. datatype or language of a literal)
        Parameters:
        val -
        Returns:

        Returns the HTML element with the given source relative to the webapplication and the current context path. Example:
        Parameters:
        relativeImgSrc -
        the - optional title
        Returns:
